div.script: var photoGallery4306= {"Album": {"title":"Photo Gallery (960 x 480)","description":"","transitiondelay":"6","fadestyle":"NO","gallerywidth":"890","backgroundaudio":"/cms/lib/WA01001468/Centricity/ModuleInstance/5601/","loopaudio":"False","lgpath":"/cms/lib/WA01001468/Centricity/ModuleInstance/5601/large/","tnpath":"/cms/lib/WA01001468/Centricity/ModuleInstance/5601/thumbs/","Images": [{"photoname":"Emergency school closure extended ","src":"school-closure-extended-slider.png?rnd=0.719718724824357","caption":"Lake Stevens school buildings, and all schools in Washington state, will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. While our school buildings will be closed, teaching and learning will continue. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Learning Resources for Families","src":"learning-resources-slider.png?rnd=0.376372078608895","caption":"Our schools are closed, but learning can continue from home in a variety of fashions. Please visit our Learning Resources for Families site!","pause":"","link":"https://sites.google.com/lkstevens.wednet.edu/lssd-learning-resources-for-fa","target":"_blank"},{"photoname":"Breakfasts and lunches and Chromebooks, oh my!","src":"meals-chromebooks-slider.png?rnd=0.260707363607691","caption":"Since the emergency school closure began on March 16, we have distributed more than 53,000 meals; delivered nearly 5,500 meals; and checked out 3,000 Chromebooks. WOW! Thank you to all of our amazing staff members who made this possible for our students and families. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"School Closure FAQ","src":"school-closure-faq-slider.png?rnd=0.880605541114046","caption":"Please see our frequently asked questions (FAQ) page for details on school closures. The page will continue to be updated as information becomes available.","pause":"","link":"https://www.lkstevens.wednet.edu/Page/5479","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Free Grab-&-Go Meals","src":"grab-go-meals-slider.png?rnd=0.923228909691437","caption":"Our Nutrition Services Department has free grab-and-go meals for any child, 18-years-old or younger, between 11:30 a.m. and 1 p.m. beginning at Lake Stevens Middle School and North Lake Middle School. Service continues during Spring Break. More details available.","pause":"","link":"https://www.lkstevens.wednet.edu/faq#grab","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Playgrounds and school facilities closed, no pets on school grounds","src":"playgrounds-no-pets-slider.png?rnd=0.885859979263442","caption":"As you enjoy the sunshine, please remember that pets are not allowed on school grounds at any time. School playgrounds, covered play areas, tracks and tennis courts are also closed in accordance with the state's \"Stay Home, Stay Healthy\" order. Please help us keep everyone safe and healthy. Thank you!","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Kindergarten Enrollment for 2020-21","src":"kindergarten-april-2020-slider.jpg?rnd=0.927522208973543","caption":"We are working on a plan for kindergarten enrollment for the upcoming school year. Once we have a decision, information will be posted to our website and social media channels. We appreciate your patience!","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"}]}}

span.p: The Educational Services Center is closed to the public. District personnel and school administrators are available via email. If you're not sure who to contact, please email tellus@lkstevens.wednet.edu and your question will be routed accordingly. If you have questions about Chromebooks or technology, please email techsupport@lkstevens.wednet.edu. Thank you for your understanding as we work to protect the health of our staff members.

a.title: Go to comments for ESC closed to public

span.p: Kindergarten enrollment: Now that school buildings are closed for the remainder of the school year, we are working on a plan for kindergarten enrollment for the 2020-21 school year. Please stay tuned for more information!

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten enrollment

p.em: Our students will be contributing members of society and lifelong learners, pursuing their passions and interests in an ever-changing world.
To inspire a community-wide culture of excellence, growth, and achievement, where individuals are supported and challenged, engaged and empowered, and recognized for their unique contributions.

img.alt: Emergency school closure extended through remainder of 2019-20 school year

a.span: Emergency school closure extended through remainder of 2019-20 school year

div.p: Gov. Jay Inslee and Superintendent of Public Instruction Chris Reykdal announced that schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. While this news is disheartening, it’s not surprising. The statewide efforts to “flatten the curve” of COVID-19 are working, and we have to continue the course to protect the safety and well-being of our students, staff members, and families. While our school buildings will be closed, teaching and learning will continue.

a.title: Go to comments for Emergency school closure extended through remainder of 2019-20 school year

div.p: When the emergency school closure started, our goal—based on guidance from the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI)—was to deepen, strengthen, and enrich students’ prior learning from this school year. Based on the new guidance from OSPI, our goals have changed now that the emergency closure has been extended for the remainder of the school year. We will now provide new learning for students, in addition to building on their prior learning.

a.title: Go to comments for Learning resources and expectations

img.alt: Lake Stevens High School Open House & Ribbon Cutting

a.span: Lake Stevens High School Open House & Ribbon Cutting

div.p: On Feb. 27, we celebrated the first phase of modernization and expansion of Lake Stevens High School. Following the ribbon cutting, guests toured the facility and enjoyed refreshments from our culinary arts students. Photo by Olivia Vanni/The Herald

a.title: Go to comments for Lake Stevens High School Open House & Ribbon Cutting

img.alt: LSHS junior earns Eagle Scout honor for bringing awareness to organ donation

a.span: LSHS junior earns Eagle Scout honor for bringing awareness to organ donation

div.p: Brayden Bowers, a junior at Lake Stevens High School, earned his Eagle Scout by focusing on a project that changed his family’s life—organ donation. Landen Bowers, Brayden’s little brother, is a fourth-grader at Glenwood Elementary School, and a heart transplant recipient. Landen received a donor heart when he was just three months old.

a.title: Go to comments for LSHS junior earns Eagle Scout honor for bringing awareness to organ donation

a.span: Lake Stevens students nab top spots in statewide Microsoft competition

div.p: Becoming certified by Microsoft is no small task. After learning a software program and practicing a myriad of techniques you have 50 minutes to complete an online examination.

a.title: Go to comments for Lake Stevens students nab top spots in statewide Microsoft competition

p.br: Sign up for e-News to get school and district information, announcements and event reminders.
Stay informed about what’s happening in our schools with the LSSD mobile app for iOS and Android phones.

span.br: File a tip or email a tip. Call or text at (855) 200-5058.
Are you in a crisis? Find help here.
